activities.loc: MDB Check Monitor & Posted Calendar for Courtroom

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Robert J Boeckman

records.addlTxt:
4:02 PM Defendant Robert J Boeckman appeared by video.  Attorney Laura Ann Sutton appeared by video for Robert J Boeckman.  Attorney Brady James Seidlitz appeared by video for State of Wisconsin.  Prosecuting attorney Brady James Seidlitz in court for the State of Wisconsin. 

4:02  Court relates and gives appearances.
4:03  Atty. Sutton indicates defendant wishes to waive right to preliminary hearing.
4:03  Court questions defendant; defendant indicates he wishes to waive right to preliminary hearing.  Court questions Atty. Sutton.
Court accepts defendant's waiver of preliminary hearing.
Court binds over.
Arraignment set; must appear in person.
Bond to continue.
Arraignment scheduled for November 11, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on August 22, 2022 at 04:00 pm.

10:29 AM Prosecuting attorney Brady James Seidlitz in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Robert J Boeckman in court.  Attorney Laura Ann Sutton in court for Robert J Boeckman.
Attorney Sutton requests preliminary hearing and waives time limits.  No address or phone number change.  Next hearing may be by zoom.  Bond continued.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 22, 2022 at 04:00 pm.

Laura Sutton to be repaid at the rate of $100.00/month to begin 8/6/2022.
***DIRECT PAY AS DEFENDANT OWNS THE BUSINESS LISTED ON PAGE 1 OF PFAC***/car

records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt: Adjourned initial appearance on August 10, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Defendant shall be fingerprinted at the Barron County Sheriff's Dept., if not already done.
If represented by the Public Defender and does not have a phone, must contact the Public Defender weekly at 715-908-8473. 

Must not possess or consume controlled substances or drug paraphernalia, except as may be prescribed by licensed physician.
Must not operate a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license.

1:11 PM Prosecuting attorney Brady James Seidlitz in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Robert J Boeckman appeared by video, in custody. Attorney Dustin Rockow appears by zoom video for today only.

Defendant must call the public defender's office to determine eligibility.  If the defendant does not qualify for public defender representation, the defendant must complete a Petition for Appointment of an Attorney, Affidavit of Indigency also known as the blue form in order for the court to consider appointing an attorney, submit before leaving justice center.
Defendant acknowledges receipt of complaint.
AIA set; must appear in person.

Bond and MS scanned to jail
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for August 10, 2022 at 10:00 am.
